item.title: Why I Stop Doing Things
item.description:
This blog post is a follow-up to What Do I Like, in which I talked about how most of the things I do are short-lived, and that I go through phases of intense focus on one activity followed by dropping it for an indeterminate amount of time.

The reason for that? Three words: fear of failure.

I’m afraid of failing, afraid of taking risks, afraid of stepping out of my comfort zone, afraid of asking for help, afraid of looking incompetent in the eyes of others.

item.title: Stuff I Enjoy: Minecraft
item.description:
Welcome to the first installment of Stuff I Enjoy! I was going to postpone this to next week but decided against it.

This installment is dedicated to Minecraft, a game that shaped my entire youth. I started playing Minecraft in 2011, around the time that Beta 1.7.3 dropped. It wasn’t until Beta 1.8 that I actually started getting more into it. Why? When I first booted it up, I created a survival world but didn’t know how to break blocks. I was trying to get wood by spam clicking it instead of holding the mouse button. Which, in hindsight, doesn’t make sense at all, but younger me thought it was the way to do it and was so confused that it wasn’t working to the point of closing the game in a fit of anger.

item.title: What Do I Like
item.description:
Lately, I’ve been trying to get into writing more. My friends Adrian, Alwinfy, and Willie encouraged me to start writing blog posts as it would be a decent way to get started. I thought about it for a while and concluded that they were right. Taking up blogging would be nice. But then, I ran into my first blocker. What would I write?

My first instinct was to do some online searching about it, as it was unlikely that I was the only person who didn’t know what to blog. The answer that showed up pretty much everywhere was to write about what you like. I gave it a lot of thought, but I couldn’t come up with anything. At this point, you, the reader, might be thinking, how is it possible that he doesn’t know what he likes?
